pageContext.claim: “In California, they're sending out millions of ballots. They don't even know who. Maybe they know too well who they're sending them to, and maybe it's the people that don't get it. Maybe it's an area of Republicans or Democrats that don't happen to get any ballots.”
pageContext.analysis: California is sending out mail ballots only to registered voters, about 20 million in all. To register to vote, people must identify themselves and once they've voted, state officials verify those ballots with a range of safety measures.
